pull.title: [net] add dnsseed.emzy.de to DNS seeds
pull.body:
ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/dnsseed-policy.md

I'm willing to keep it up and running, unless something bad happens.
I have 15+ years experience running dns servers.

About my setup:

- the server may change over time, but the service will be up all the time
- running [sipa/bitcoin-seeder](https://github.com/sipa/bitcoin-seeder) with default settings (and the non-root port redirect)

verification.payload:
tree cf0f1b0d9e1acaed79d858177afc808fa3bb40ca
parent 9133227298ad97bbb10c44ac038f614c0bd7f7c7
author Stephan Oeste <emzy@emzy.de> 1544887426 +0100
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1544887426 +0100

[net] add dnsseed.emzy.de to DNS seeds

events.body: I can't see any prior contribution to this project by @Emzy. I suggest only adding DNS seeds from long term contributors.

I don't think code contributors should necessarily overlap with service contributors. In fact, it may be a positive thing to have at least one or two seeds run by non-developers. Regardless, we've had such in the past, and adding this new requirement seems like a topic for a PR to the policy document.
The DNS seed seems to be working. Tried querying it and the addresses I got back were connectable.
I've at least met @Emzy in person a few times, for whatever small amount that's worth.
Concept ACK. I think it's generally better to have more separately-run seeders. I've also met @Emzy in person.
Ok I think we should probably do this then.
